This story interested me
 
 Royal Festival Hall removes sculpture by child murderer Colin Pitchfork - Times Online
 
 Now I don't want to debate his art as I have no appreciation for visual art whatsoever (well except for lowbrow stuff such as comics, graffiti and tattoos).
 
 But I have been struggling to form an opinion on prisoners for a long time. Should they be punished or rehabilitated and where is the line drawn? if there a need for life sentences would it be better to put them to death? When a prisoner is freed has he paid his debt to society and how does this affect his victims' rights? I also have side issues such as I wonder if motive or indeed psychological reasons matters and lastly, should be allowed to vote?
 
 If this comes across as a messy, jumbled and confused post it only means that I have expressed myself perfectly. I can see I am offering choices between black and white areas whereas everything is, I assume, gray.
 
 I know that I have brought up too many issues for one thread so please only answer the points that interest you.
 
 Finally please feel free to suggest reading material as I have a whole summer coming up to sit on a beach and read about the imprisoned.
